Name: Fluopimomide
Description: Fluopimomide is a benzamide resulting from the formal condensation of the carboxy group of 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoro-4-methoxybenzoic acid with the amino group of 1-[3-chloro-5-(trifluoromethyl)pyridin-2-yl]methanamine. It is a benzamide fungicide, synthesized by Shandong Sino-Agri United Biotechnology Co., Ltd (China). Used for the control of cucumber and grape downy mildew, phytophthora capsici, litchi downy blight, potato late blight, rice sheath blight, and cotton rhizoctonia solani. It has a role as an antifungal agrochemical. It is a monochloropyridine, a benzamide fungicide, an organofluorine compound, a member of benzamides and a monomethoxybenzene.

plant_translocations.content: The efficacy of a new fluorinated benzamide compound LH-2010A (fluopimomide) against Pseudoperonospora cubensis, and its uptake-translocate behavior in cucumber plants were studied. The calculated EC50 (effective concentration for 50% inhibition) for LH-2010A was 6.70 µg/mL, while fluopicolide had an EC50 of 7.67 µg/mL. LH-2010A was found to be absorbed by the plants and translocated to other sites within the plant. The downward transportation observed for LH-2010A differed from that of fluopicolide. The absorption of LH-2010A by cucumber roots was inhibited by low temperature, respiratory inhibitors, sucrose, and amino acids, indicating that the absorption process is an active process.
plant_translocations.reference: Zhang, R., Wang, H. Y., Xv, H., Wang, J., & Wang, K. Y. (2014). Uptake and transportation behavior of a new fungicidal agent LH-2010A in cucumber plants. Journal of Pesticide Science, 39(1), 43-47.

method.Plant Grown Condition: Cucumber leaves bearing zoosporangia of the pathogen were collected from a suburb of Tai’san, Shandong Province, China. The backs of the diseased single leaves were washed with distilled water and then kept in moist petri dishes at 20°C for a 12-hr photoperiod until new mold emerged after 24 hr.
method.Chemical Preparation: LH-2010A (purity: 98%), fluopicolide (purity: 96%), thiram (purity: 95%), and metalaxyl (purity: 98%) were dissolved in methanol and diluted with distilled water to prepare solutions at concentrations of 1.25, 2.5, 5, 10, and 20 µg/mL active ingredient (a.i.). Methanol concentration in the solution never exceeded 1%.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Leaf disks (1 cm in diameter) were cut from healthy cucumber leaves and placed on the surface of 10 mL fungicide solution in a petri dish. The abaxial side of the disks was inoculated with a 10 µL sporangia suspension using a microPette plus (Eppendorf). There were 10 disks per dish and 5 replications per concentration. The dishes were kept at 20°C in a light incubator for 7 days.
